metadata.feature_description: Create new wiki articles with title, content, and metadata, supporting both draft and published states

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module in Test Activity Group
steps.expected: Wiki module page loads with article list
steps.actual: Wiki module page loaded successfully showing existing articles

steps.action: Click 'Create article' button to open dialog
steps.expected: Create article dialog opens with form fields
steps.actual: Dialog opened with Title, Article Type, Content, Approved checkbox, Tags, and Subscribe fields

steps.action: Fill form with title, type, content, tags and UNCHECK the Approved checkbox
steps.actual: Form filled successfully with Approved checkbox unchecked (draft mode)
Article was saved as draft (SaveDraft API called due to unchecked Approved)

steps.action: Open Create article dialog and fill form with Approved checkbox CHECKED
steps.expected: Form accepts all inputs with Approved checkbox checked
steps.actual: Form filled successfully with Approved checkbox checked

steps.expected: Article published immediately and visible in article list
steps.actual: Article 'Published Article Test - Claude' was published immediately and redirected to article detail page

steps.action: Click 'Edit' on the front page article section to open primary article editor
steps.expected: Simplified editor opens for primary article (content only)
steps.actual: Primary article editor opened with simplified form showing only Content field
Primary article content was updated successfully and displayed on the Wiki front page

steps.action: Open Create article dialog and click Publish without filling any fields
steps.expected: Validation messages appear for required fields
steps.actual: Validation messages appeared: 'Text is required' for Title, Content, and Tags fields

steps.action: Create article with profanity words (damn, hell) in title and content
steps.expected: Profanity filter blocks or filters the content
steps.actual: Article was created successfully with profanity words intact - profanity filter appears to be in FilterContent mode (not ProhibitContent) or disabled

issues: Profanity filter did not block or filter content containing 'damn' and 'hell'. The filter may be disabled or configured in FilterContent mode rather than ProhibitContent mode.

steps.action: Attempt to create article with same title as existing article
steps.expected: Error message prevents duplicate title creation
steps.actual: Error displayed: 'Unable to publish: An error has occurred' - duplicate title was rejected (406 Not Acceptable response)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create article with special characters in title

steps.action: Create article with title containing special characters: <>, &, @, #, $, !
steps.expected: Special characters are handled properly (encoded or sanitized)
steps.actual: Article created successfully. Angle brackets with content (<Characters>) were stripped for XSS prevention. Other special characters (&, @, #, $, !) were preserved in the title.

steps.expected: Article title displays with proper encoding
steps.actual: Article displayed with title 'Test Article: Special & Symbols @#$!' - angle brackets sanitized, other characters preserved

steps.action: Attempt to enter title exceeding 100 characters (150 chars attempted)
steps.expected: Title is truncated to maximum allowed length
steps.actual: HTML maxlength attribute enforced 100 character limit. Title was truncated from 150 to exactly 100 characters by the browser.

steps.action: Create article with maximum length title and verify
steps.actual: Article created successfully with full 100-character title: 'This is an extremely long article title that is designed to test the maximum title length validation'

observations: Profanity filter appears to be disabled or configured in FilterContent mode (allowing content through rather than blocking). The code suggests ProhibitContent mode should block articles with profanity, but the test article with 'damn' and 'hell' was accepted.

The 'Approved' checkbox controls whether an article is saved as draft (unchecked) or published immediately (checked). The Publish button calls either SaveDraft or Publish API based on this checkbox state.
Angle brackets in titles are sanitized/stripped for XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) prevention, which is proper security behavior.
Title maxlength is enforced at 100 characters via HTML attribute (SocialConstants.TitleMaxLength).
Duplicate title prevention returns a 406 Not Acceptable HTTP response with a user-friendly error message.
Primary/home article has a simplified editor showing only the Content field (no Title, Type, or Tags required).
